title: FELLE: Autoregressive Speech Synthesis with Token-Wise Coarse-to-Fine Flow Matching
author: Hui Wang (Nankai University), Shujie Liu (Microsoft Corporation), Lingwei Meng (Microsoft Corporation), Jinyu Li (Microsoft Corporation), Yifan Yang (Microsoft Corporation), Shiwan Zhao (Nankai University), Haiyang Sun (Microsoft Corporation), Yanqing Liu (Microsoft Corporation), Haoqin Sun (Nankai University)
relevance_why: The paper discusses advanced techniques in speech synthesis, particularly through autoregressive modeling and flow matching, which could enhance Haohe Liu's research in text-to-audio generation and audio processing.
background: The paper explores a framework for generating speech from text by sequentially synthesizing mel-spectrograms using autoregressive models and flow-matching techniques to ensure high fidelity and coherence.
contribution: FELLE introduces token-wise flow matching for continuous speech modeling to solve coherency and quality issues in speech synthesis, achieving high fidelity in generated speech.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with modeling complex temporal dependencies and maintaining spectral coherence.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by leveraging a dynamic prior mechanism and a coarse-to-fine flow matching architecture, enhancing coherence while capturing fine details in mel-spectrogram generation.

key_innovation: The combination of autoregressive language modeling with token-wise flow matching allows for improved temporal and spectral modeling of continuous audio representations.
real_world_impact: The advancements in speech synthesis quality can have broad applications in virtual assistants, accessibility technologies, and personalized audio content generation.
limitations: The evaluation is primarily focused on English, limiting insights into the model's performance across diverse languages.

new_terms.mel-spectrogram: **Mel-spectrogram** is a representation of sound that visualizes the spectrum of frequencies of a signal as it varies with time, used extensively in audio processing.
new_terms.autoregressive modeling: **Autoregressive modeling** involves predicting future values in a sequence based on past values, often used in time series and audio synthesis.
new_terms.flow matching: **Flow matching** is a method of transforming probability distributions to facilitate effective density estimation without rigid assumptions.
